answers.question: Telegram Handle We Can Use To Contact You
Link to your Public Group Chat
Have you participated in a previous Gitcoin Grants Round? If so, please name the rounds or link the builder profile to prior rounds.

answers.answer:
q/acc has run an initial grants season with Polygon and is running a second one next month. The tech is built on the EVM and is open source.

We have innovated on QF to make it work for token launches. This novel approach hopefully can inspire more innovations in QF mechanism design.

We have successfully supported the launch of 8 new token economies with deep liquidity from vetted and reputable builders, raised 342K POL from supporters and created 8M in TVL.
answers.question: How does your project contribute significantly to the Ethereum network's infrastructure? Please provide specific examples and metrics if available.

answers.answer: We are trailblazing a novel web3 mechanism, q/acc, supporting ecosystems, builders and their community by aligning the incentives of all parties by pioneering the combination of quadratic funding and augmented bonding curves.
answers.question: Describe any pioneering development work in your project, particularly in enhancing privacy, interoperability, or user experience.

answers.answer:
Incentive misalignment between blockchains, builders and users.

Problems:


Ecosystems: Grant funding often puts price pressure on the ecosystem token and the results are not always tied to the grant funding spent.
Builders: Lack of support, funding and revenue mechanisms.
Community: They usually have no power in allocating grants, and if they do it requires sacrifice (time or donations) with no upside.


Using q/acc as a solution:

- Ecosystems: Lock grantees into your ecosystem by tying the value of their token to the value of yours, most of the grant gets locked on chain as liquidity, creating TVL and token demand.
- Builders: Subsidized launch for their token economy with a clear revenue stream, deep liquidity and support from an ecosystem.
- Community: Direct ecosystem grant funding, while getting early access and upside on low-cap token projects.
answers.question: What specific problems or challenges in the Ethereum ecosystem does your project address? How does your solution improve upon existing alternatives?

answers.answer:
Our roadmap will focus on making onboarding and using q/acc a zero-friction user experience. 
* Chain abstraction.
* Fiat onboarding
* AI co-marketing for teams
* Points system
* Finding more ecosystem partners
answers.question: Outline your project's roadmap and how the grant funds will be used to achieve your development goals.

answers.answer: q/acc is a new protocol to help Ethereum ecosystems grow through grants that promote new fair token launches with deep liquidity. We are 100% open source and are enabling small, legitimate projects stop chasing grants and instead tokenize the value they create.
answers.question: How does your project contribute to the decentralization and security of the Ethereum network?

For any project deploying smart contracts on blockchain networks, please list all your deployer addresses and their corresponding blockchain networks. Use this format for each entry: [deployer_address], [chain_id]â€”for example, 0x123abc..., 42161 (This represents a deployer address on the Arbitrum network). Please include a separate line for each unique deployer address and blockchain combination.

project.title: q/acc-  Quadratic Accelerator
project.description:
The Quadratic Accelerator is pioneering a novel tokenization protocol that combines the strengths of Quadratic Funding (QF) with those of Augmented Bonding Curves (ABCs).



Why q/acc?


Hundreds of millions of USD-equivalent flow out of web3 grant systems every year yet protocols cannot predictably produce the highly sought after chain commitment and native token hodlers. Web3 projects refrain from tokenizing because of the costs and complexities. Web3 communities receive no upside from their support and have a crowded space of unvetted projects upon which to speculate.



We're about to change all of that.



Quadratic Acceleration (q/acc) combines the strengths of Quadratic Funding (QF) with those of Augmented Bonding Curves (ABC) in order to create a new mechanism for launching tokens with built-in liquidity, a passive revenue stream and a clear path to community growth.



Makes early funding rounds open and accessible to all, not just VCs.
Rewards supporters with privileged access and token upside. 
Aligns incentives between protocols, projects and community.
Drives long-term adoption for protocols. 


Key benefits of q/acc

Project Tokenization
Projects launch their ABC token with built-in liquidity and protection measures for the project and the community.


Community Stake
Supporters receive tokens in return for their support and the quadratic matched allocation is used to build secondary market liquidity.


Liquidity + Revenue
Secondary market liquidity grows with each q/acc round, and a passive revenue stream flows to the project from ABC tributes.



How does q/acc work in practice? 



Each season accepts up to 10 projects into our 10-week program. During that time projects will launch their ABC tokens, invite KOL, contributors and others to have priority access to the team and token, and join their first q/acc round where those early supporters may acquire tokens, and the quadratic matching pool funds will build secondary market liquidity for projects. 



After completing a season, projects may participate in all future q/acc rounds.
